data.title: Georgia Southern University Athletics
data.meta_description:
Davis Brin (5) Quarterback  - 2023 - All-Sun Belt Conference Honorable Mention
2023 - College Sports Communicators Academic All-District

2023-24: Started all
data.text:
2023 - All-Sun Belt Conference Honorable Mention

2023 - College Sports Communicators Academic All-District

2023-24: Started all 13 games … Saw action on 963 offensive snaps … Completed 362 of 552 passes for 3m781 yards and 24 touchdowns … Had 19 interceptions … An honorable mention All-Sun Belt selection from the league … A College Sports Communicators Academic All-District selection … Threw for 244 yards and two touchdowns in the opener against The Citadel … Named the Sun Belt Offensive Player of the Week after throwing for 318 yards and two touchdowns on 38-of-47 passing in the win over UAB … Also had a 4-yard touchdown run … Threw for 383 yards and a touchdown at Wisconsin … Completed 34 of 46 passes for 344 yards and four touchdowns in the win at Ball State … Threw for 322 yards and three touchdowns in the win over Coastal Carolina … Threw for 271 yards at James Madison … Had two touchdown passes and threw for 240 yards in the win over ULM … Completed 22 of 35 passes for 334 yards and three touchdowns in the win over Georgia State … Named to the Davey O’Brien Award Great 8 for the week … Threw for 195 yards and a score at Texas State … Selected to wear the #0 jersey for that game … Threw for 307 yards and three touchdowns at Marshall … Had 235 yards through the air and a late touchdown against Old Dominion … Threw for 238 yards at App State … Threw for 350 yards and two touchdowns against Ohio in the Myrtle Beach Bowl.

2022-23: Played in and started nine games at Tulsa … Completed 148 of 250 passes for 2,138 yards and 17 touchdowns … Started the season by going 30 of 52 for a career-high 460 yards and three touchdowns at Wyoming … Threw four touchdowns against NIU and Jacksonville State … After the first three weeks, before suffering an injury in the fourth game, led the nation in passing yards (1,206), passing yards per game (402.0), passing touchdowns (11) and total offense (397.0) … Missed the Tulane game with an injury, snapping his streak of consecutive starts at 21 … Did not play against USF due to injury … Had a touchdown pass in the loss at Ole Miss … Threw for 237 yards against Cincinnati … Threw two touchdown passes and for 284 yards at Navy … Had two more touchdown passes at Temple … Did not play in the final four games … Entered the NCAA Transfer Portal in November and enrolled at Georgia Southern in January … Made the President’s List in the spring for earning a perfect 4.00 GPA.

2021-22: Started all 13 games for Tulsa … Completed 244-of-411 passes for 3,269 yards and 18 touchdowns in 13 starts … Had six games with 250+ yards thrown … His 3,269 yards was the seventh best single season passing performance for a Tulsa quarterback … Threw for over 200 yards in the first half in three games – Ohio State, Arkansas State and Temple … Had his first career start in the 2021 season opener, completed 15-of-28 passes for 201 yards vs. UC Davis … Completed 70 percent of his passes (19-of-27) for 224 yards at Oklahoma State … Had back-to-back 350+ passing games vs. No. 9 Ohio State and Arkansas State … Threw for a career-high 428 yards and two scores with highs of 31-for-54 pass attempts at Ohio State … His 428 yards was the 11th most in school history and the 19th 400+ yard passing game for a Tulsa quarterback … Completed 68 percent of his passes (17-of-25) for 355 yards and a career-high three touchdowns vs. Arkansas State … Was named the AAC Offensive Player of the Week for his performance against ASU … Completed 20 passes against Houston … Threw touchdown passes of 28 and 63 yards against Memphis … Threw for 266 yards and two touchdowns at South Florida … Completed 65% of his passes for 149 yards and a 21-yard TD at No. 2-ranked Cincinnati … Completed 19-of-30 passes for 297 yards and two TDs vs. Temple … Threw for 244 yards and one TD against SMU … Was the MVP of the 2021 Myrtle Beach Bowl as he completed 65% of his passes for 285 yards and two touchdowns, while rushing for 18 yards.

2020-21: Played in two games … Completed 19-of-29 passes for 268 yards and two scores … Saw his first action of the season in the USF game, completing his first career passing attempt for 2 yards … Saw his most extensive action against Tulane, coming in late in the third quarter for an injured Seth Boomer … Led Tulsa to a 30-24 comeback win, leading the Golden Hurricane on three fourth quarter touchdown drives to tie the score at 21 at the end of regulation … Completed 18-of-28 passes for 266 yards and two touchdowns, while rushing for an 18-yard score in the Tulane game … Threw a ‘Hail Mary’ 37-yard pass to JC Santana in the end zone at the 0:00 mark to tie the score … Was named the AAC’s Co-Offensive Player of the Week for his performance.

2019-20: Played in one game … Only appearance came at East Carolina when he quarterbacked Tulsa’s last series of the game.

2018-19: Redshirted his true freshman season at Tulsa … Saw action in one game … Saw his only playing time against UConn and had one rushing attempt.

HIGH SCHOOL: Was a three-year letterwinner at Boerne Champion High School for Coach Keith Kaiser, and two-year starter at quarterback … Completed 463-of-799 passes for 6,650 yards and 58 touchdowns during his career, while rushing for 795 yards, a 4.9 average and 15 touchdowns on 162 carries … Threw for 2,548 yards and 24 TDs and rushed for 414 yards and six touchdowns as a senior … Named first-team Academic All-State as a senior … Was the District 26-5A Offensive MVP as a senior … Was chosen to play in the San Antonio Sports All-Star Football Game … Threw for 3,535 yards and 30 touchdowns his junior season … Earned first-team all-district and all-area honors as a junior, while being named the San Antonio Quarterback Club Player of the Year … Earned a three-star Rivals.com rating … Passed for 567 yards and four touchdowns his sophomore season … Also lettered two years in track, while tying the school record in the high jump with a jump of 6’4”.

PERSONAL: Born Davis William Brin on February 7 in San Antonio … Son of Barry and Lara Brin … Has one younger sister, Ashley

MAJOR: Finance (Graduated; Tulsa)
